reviewText: This is a good workout. I would say it is easy to follow and has a lot of information on doing the workout without injury. Larry Lam is a good motivator and has a lot of energy. More for those starting out with kickboxing then those that have been doing kickboxing for a long time.

I didn't think much of this set when I received it as a gift a few months ago -- but after having used it numerous times I can definitively say it's one of the best I've seen.

Precise yet not too detailed or uncustomizable instruction, and a healthy but not ridiculous pace -- this tape is suitable for everyone.
XKO is my favorite kickbox video. I need good music and fast pace to keep my interest. This is it. I went to his web site and sent an e-mail and learned his next video comes out Summer 2003.

I take cardio kickboxing at the YMCA Presidio gym in San Francisco, and I have been trying to find something that resembles the intensity of workouts led by Omar & Elizabeth! To date, XKO Kickboxing is my favorite to date (compared to Kathy Smith, Taebo Advanced and Eversley Forte's Cardio II). I think it could use more kicks tho coz that's what really gets my heart rate up. I like high quality production tapes like The Firm, so I appreciate the way XKO is done... and it has good music to boot! The instruction at the beginning of the tape covers the basics well, and the 20-min supplementary tape of standing drills is excellent for distinguishing between the different types of kicks and improving form. I rate this an intermediate-advanced tape, and so my quest for an advanced tape continues: I will definitely write a review for Dawei as soon as I get to it!
This is a great workout with awesome music.  The only complaint I have is that the lead-in is to long
